msIdentifier.idno: Oxford, Sackler Library, Papyrology Rooms P. Ant. 125

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

div.p: Medical fragments (P.Ant. 3.125). Numerous fragments of a papyrus codex of good quality and of unidentifiable medical content. Large, careful, sloping bookhand dated to the 6th cent. AD.

p.note: This papyrus has been digitally edited by Francesca Corazza as part of the Project "DIGMEDTEXT - Online Humanities Scholarship: A Digital Medical Library based on Ancient Texts" (ERC-AdG-2013, Grant Agreement no. 339828) funded by the European Research Council at the University of Parma (Principal Investigator: Prof. Isabella Andorlini). The digital edition is mostly based on the previous edition (J.W.B. Barnes, P.Ant. III 125).
